intro: Marrubium × montenegrinum, commonly known as the Montenegro horehound, is a hybrid plant belonging to the family Boraginaceae. It is characterized by its hairy, gray-green leaves and small blue or purple flowers that bloom in summer. Native to the Balkan Peninsula, this plant thrives in rocky and dry environments. It is often found in mountainous regions and is adapted to poor, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
